summary: Build DOC C, a modern React web application for doctor recruitment and emergency connectivity with Doctor, Hospital Admin, and System Administrator roles, including dashboards, search/filters, notifications, analytics, hospital subscription/payments, and real phone-number OTP authentication via Firebase.
architectural_notes: Frontend framework: React (preferred) with clean component structure, reusable UI components, and module-based routing for Doctor/Hospital/Admin.
UI/UX: Medical professional theme (blue/white), clean minimal design, smooth animations, fully responsive for mobile and desktop.
Use dummy/sample data to demonstrate dashboards, charts, notifications, and payment/subscription flows.

Authentication/identity: Use Firebase Phone Authentication for real SMS OTP verification with reCAPTCHA; persist user profile data in Firebase Firestore (replace dummy OTP/auth flows where applicable).

UI style update: apply modern glassmorphism (soft blur, translucent surfaces, soft shadows) for the Doctor Profile Dashboard with smooth micro-interactions and fully responsive 3-column-to-stacked layout.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Soft blue medical hero background with subtle gradient and abstract healthcare shapes (doctor-hero-bg.dim_1920x600.png)
- Professional doctor headshot portrait suitable for a profile avatar (doctor-anil-kapoor-avatar.dim_512x512.png)
- Minimal map preview tile with light roads/blocks styling and a prominent location pin (map-preview-tile.dim_640x360.png)

existing_features.title: Create the DOC C application shell with responsive layout, global navigation, and routing for Doctor, Hospital Admin, and System Administrator modules (including registration, login, dashboards, analytics, and subscription/payment pages).

Implement a consistent medical professional UI theme (blue + white) with clean minimal styling, modern cards/dashboards, and smooth animations across key interactions (toggles, notifications, modals, success states).

Build the Doctor Registration page UI with fields: name, email, phone number, OTP verification flow, password creation, specialization dropdown with heart icon animation, experience (years), location, and profile photo upload (client-side preview).
Build the Doctor Login page UI and connect it to a dummy authentication session (no external auth provider), enabling access to the Doctor Dashboard after login.

Implement the Doctor Dashboard UI featuring: profile card with photo, specialization displayed inside an animated heart symbol, experience, location, availability toggle (Available/Not Available), edit profile action, notification panel for job alerts, and applied jobs section.
Implement the hospital-to-doctor matching notification experience: when a hospital requirement matches a doctorâ€™s specialization, show a notification alert and an animated popup in the Doctor UI.
Build the Hospital Registration page UI with fields: hospital name, departments, location, accreditation, and contact details; store submitted hospital profile in dummy app state.

Build the Hospital Dashboard UI with overview cards (Total Doctors Available, Emergency Cases, Active Hires), doctor search and filters (specialization, experience, location, availability), emergency mode toggle (red highlight mode), and a doctor list with profile info and a Hire action.
Create the Hospital Analytics section UI with charts for emergency trends and doctor availability statistics, plus performance insight cards, all populated from dummy sample data.
Build the System Administrator module UI to view all registered doctors and hospitals, approve/reject profiles, manage subscription plans, and monitor payments (UI-driven with dummy data).

Implement the Hospital Subscription & Payments UI: plan selection (monthly/yearly), UPI payment option, card payment option, auto-renew toggle, invoice download action, payment history table, and a payment success animation.

Implement end-to-end workflow logic using dummy sample data and simulated real-time updates: doctors register and create profiles; hospitals subscribe and search; hospitals send hire requests; doctors receive notifications; doctors accept/reject; hospital and doctor dashboards update via polling/interval-based refresh in the UI.

Add a Motoko backend actor that exposes CRUD-style endpoints for doctors, hospitals, hire requests, notifications, subscriptions, and payments using stable storage; integrate the frontend to fetch/mutate via React Query.
Add generated static brand assets and wire them into the UI (app header/login screens) as files under frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images from the backend).

Block the requested Firebase Phone Authentication + reCAPTCHA + Firestore implementation and surface a clear, user-facing explanation that Firebase authentication/Firestore are not supported in this platform; provide a supported alternative sign-in path using Internet Identity for authentication and the existing Motoko canister for user profile persistence.

Update Doctor authentication gating so that dashboard access is granted only when the user is authenticated via Internet Identity (not via the current dummy Zustand session), and ensure logout returns the user to the appropriate login screen.

Persist authenticated user profile data in the existing Motoko backend (stable storage) instead of Firebase Firestore, and wire the frontend to create/read the caller's profile via the canister after successful authentication.

Create a premium, glassmorphism-style Doctor Profile Dashboard UI that matches a modern hospital recruitment platform aesthetic: a full-width soft-blue medical hero background with a centered, rounded, shadowed profile card laid out in three responsive columns (left/contact/actions+rating, center/core profile details, right/about+map preview).

Implement the left column content exactly as specified: circular doctor photo; hospital name; phone number; email; location; a 5-star rating display; a primary blue "Contact Now" button; and a destructive red "Hire Doctor" button.

Implement the center column content exactly as specified: large Doctor Name, specialization below name, years of experience, skills list, availability status as a green badge reading "Available Now", and working hours.
Implement the right column content exactly as specified: an About section (short description) and a small map preview with a location pin indicator.
Add smooth animations matching the specification: profile card fade-in on initial load; buttons scale slightly on hover; star rating animation; and an availability badge pulse effect.

Populate the Doctor Profile Dashboard with the provided dummy sample data and keep all user-facing text in English: Dr. Anil Kapoor (Neurosurgeon, 12 years experience), plus reasonable dummy values for hospital name, phone, email, location, rating, skills, working hours, and about text.

Integrate the new premium Doctor Profile Dashboard into the existing doctor route structure without breaking current Internet Identity authentication gating and profile setup behavior (doctor users must still be required to authenticate before viewing the dashboard).
Add any required generated static images as files under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the Doctor Profile Dashboard (do not serve images from the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Set up React frontend app structure with routing between Doctor, Hospital, and System Admin modules; responsive medical (blue/white) UI with reusable components and smooth animations.

Doctor module: registration (fields incl. OTP verification, specialization dropdown with heart animation, profile photo upload), login, and doctor dashboard (profile card, availability toggle, edit profile, notifications, applied jobs).

Hospital module: hospital registration and hospital dashboard with overview cards, doctor search + filters (specialization/experience/location/availability), emergency mode toggle (red highlight), doctor list with hire action.
Hospital analytics UI: graphs for emergency trends, doctor availability stats, and performance insight cards.
System admin module UI: view all doctors/hospitals, approve/reject profiles, manage subscription plans, and monitor payments.
Payment & subscription UI for hospitals: monthly/yearly plans, UPI + card payments, auto-renew toggle, invoice download, payment history table, and payment success animation.
Workflow/interaction logic in UI with dummy data: hospital hire requests to doctors, doctor accept/reject, job alert notifications with animated popup, and real-time dashboard updates (simulated).
Include dummy sample data for doctors, hospitals, subscriptions, payments, and analytics to populate dashboards and charts.

Implement real phone-number OTP authentication using Firebase Phone Auth (SMS OTP + reCAPTCHA), enable phone number login, store user profiles in Firebase Firestore, and gate dashboard access on successful OTP verification (no dummy OTP).

Create a premium, responsive Doctor Profile Dashboard page (glassmorphism) with full-width soft blue hero background; centered 3-column profile card (left contact/actions+rating, center core details/skills/availability, right about+map preview); smooth animations (fade-in, hover scale, rating animation, pulsing availability badge) using dummy data (Dr. Anil Kapoor, Neurosurgeon, 12 years).
